fields.Title: BOOKSTORE / BIOGRAPHIES
fields.Description: Shelf full of biographies of famous people.

fields.Title: START
input
Plaisance: ""A very influential historical figu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "A very influential historical figure, but surely I don't have to tell you that." She waves her hand, as if casting aside the thought. "You're a law officer and law officers have at least *some* education."

fields.Title: Shelf of Biographies: ""High Speed Love" chronicles the ro..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "High Speed Love" chronicles the romance between two of the finest TipTop Tourn√©e racers in history. One of them is the madcap driver Jacob Irw. His blond mane graces the cover.

fields.Title: Shelf of Biographies: "Next to Irw's life story, you see a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Next to Irw's life story, you see a slim biography of an Occidental rock star called "The Antistar". He's famous for shooting morphine into one of his eyeballs, and cocaine into the other!

fields.Title: Shelf of Biographies: "The plaque on the shelf reads: "Bio..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The plaque on the shelf reads: "Biographies of Famous People." You see a large variety of names, none of which ring a bell.

fields.Title: Shelf of Biographies: "Browsing through all the books with..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Browsing through all the books with all their names makes your head spin. None of these seem important or relevant. It's all just vapid egoism!

fields.Title: Shelf of Biographies: "Next to that, Revacholian radio-per..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Next to that, Revacholian radio-personality Guillaume Bevy stands in front of a run down drug den. He's a permanent fixture on Channel 8, reporting on real life crime and ruining cops' days...

fields.Title: biohub
Jump to: [biohub]
Plaisance: ""I really *must* insist you buy one..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I really *must* insist you buy one of the books." You're interrupted by the shopkeep. "Reading them is not for free. Do still browse though. But not too *long*."

fields.Title: You: ""Who or what is an innocence?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Who or what is an innocence?"

fields.Title: Plaisance: ""I would say..." The woman hums to..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I would say..." The woman hums to herself. "'The Greatest Innocence.' Yes, most certainly. It's an important educational tool, delving into the depths of history, religion, and their relation to *innocentic power*."

fields.Title: Variable["tc.turn_off_tutorial_node"]  or  Variable["character.interactable_tutorial_seen"]
Variable["tc.turn_off_tutorial_node"]  or  Variable["character.interactable_tutorial_seen"]
!(Variable["tc.turn_off_tutorial_node"]  or  Variable["character.interactable_tutorial_seen"])
Tutorial Agent: "You've acquired an interactable ite..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You've acquired an interactable item. Investigate this item further by going to the INTERACT tab in your INVENTORY.

fields.Title: Plaisance: ""Perhaps for a layman!" She scoffs...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Perhaps for a layman!" She scoffs. "Deep analysis is necessary to peel back the multi-layered meanings."

fields.Title: You: "What's it about?"
fields.Dialogue Text: What's it about?

fields.Title: Plaisance: ""The book is also very daring. The..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The book is also very daring. The author aims to re-examine the universal understandings of the innocentic system, creating a fresh vantage point and a shift in the tired order of things."

fields.Title: You: "[Leave.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: [Leave.]

fields.Title: You: ""I'm interested in that 'Greatest I..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm interested in that 'Greatest Innocence' book."

fields.Title: You: ""Storekeep, anything of note in thi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Storekeep, anything of note in this shelf?"

fields.Title: Plaisance: ""A true cultural touchstone." She n..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "A true cultural touchstone." She nods. "Enjoy the read."

fields.Title: Jump to: [biohub]
Suggestion: "She understands she has erred again..."
fields.Dialogue Text: She understands she has erred against the customer and immediately corrects course.

fields.Title: Composure: "You will attain a place on this she..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You will attain a place on this shelf one day... or *die trying*!

fields.Title: Shelf of Biographies: "Shelves full of biographies of *fam..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Shelves full of biographies of *famous people*, whoever they are.

fields.Title: You: "Look through the display of books."
fields.Dialogue Text: Look through the display of books.

fields.Title: You: ""Great. I don't need to know any mo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Great. I don't need to know any more."

fields.Title: You: ""I thought it was about which of th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I thought it was about which of these... innocences... is the coolest and greatest?"

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "Do her words seem vague and abstrac..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Do her words seem vague and abstract to you?

fields.Title: Jump to: [Shelf of Biographies: "Shelves full of biographies of *fam..."]
Jump to: [biohub]
Plaisance: ""I'm sorry, I did not mean to rush..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm sorry, I did not mean to rush you. You *are* browsing. Go ahead. Take your time. Time is commerce."

fields.Title: Plaisance: ""Certainly. It's prudent for a pers..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Certainly. It's prudent for a person to have at least an elementary understanding of history and society. Imagine the chaos we'd be in otherwise."

fields.Title: Variable["doomed.bookstore_famous_hub_reached"]
Variable["doomed.bookstore_famous_hub_reached"]
!(Variable["doomed.bookstore_famous_hub_reached"])
Inland Empire: "You feel like you should get this o..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You feel like you should get this one. Definitely. It's *important* somehow. There is something personal inside...

fields.Title: You: ""So you recommend it?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "So you recommend it?"

fields.Title: Shelf of Biographies: "Suddenly, a particularly odd title..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Suddenly, a particularly odd title catches your eye. It reads: "High Speed Love: the Tragic True Love Story of Jacob Irw and Alfie Deletraz" by one Cecilia Averbrook.
